page.title: 05Transport
page.content: {CANAL A now disused and neglected part of the old Wilts and Berks canal runs through the fields to the west of Drayton.The canal,opened in 1810,completed a route from Bath through Drayton to the Thames at Abingdon. {ROADS The B4017 Drayton to Steventon,once on the main Oxford to Newbury route,now carries only local traffic and is relatively quiet. The A34 dual carriageway Oxford to Newbury road now bypasses Drayton and Steventon and is a busy and important route. The Steventon_East Hanney road is a quiet road carrying only light traffic.
